tit.cmt: KTRのサイトより、Iwatakiguchi としました。

sen.j: 岩滝口駅（いわたきぐちえき）は、京都府宮津市須津にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Suzu, Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, Iwataki-guchi Station is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
Iwataki-guchi Station, located in Suzu, Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
Iwatakiguchi Station, located in Suzu, Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
sen.cmt: KTRのサイトより、Iwatakiguchi としました。

sen.j: 駅は宮津市内にあるが、鉄道駅の無かった旧岩滝町（現・与謝野町）の玄関駅であるため、岩滝町への入り口という意味で「岩滝口駅」と名称がついている。
sen.e: The station resides in Miyazu City, but it is called 'Iwataki-guchi Station,' meaning the entrance to Iwataki-cho, as the station serves as a gateway to the old Iwataki-cho (the current Yosano-cho), which did not have a train station.

The station resides in Miyazu City but is called 'Iwataki-guchi Station,' meaning the entrance to Iwataki-cho, since the station serves as a gateway to the old Iwataki-cho (the current Yosano-cho), which didn't have a train station.

The station resides in Miyazu City but is called 'Iwatakiguchi Station,' meaning the entrance to Iwataki-cho, since the station serves as a gateway to the old Iwataki-cho (the current Yosano-cho), which didn't have a train station.
sen.cmt: KTRのサイトより、Iwatakiguchi としました。

sen.j: 普通列車、快速列車のみ停車。
sen.e: Only Local trains and Rapid trains stop at the station.
Only local and rapid trains stop at the station.
Only local and rapid trains stop at the station.

sen.j: 1996年3月16日のJRダイヤ改正までは、急行列車「たんば (列車)」1号・2号（西舞鶴駅まで普通列車として運転。）5号（西舞鶴から普通列車）・8号・9号の停車駅だった。
sen.e: Before the JR's schedule revision of March 16, 1996, Limited Express Tamba Nos. 1 and 2 (these trains run to Nishi-Maizuru Station as Local trains), No. 5 (this train runs as a Local train from Nishi-Maizuru Station), Nos. 8, and 9 would stop at Iwataki-guchi Station.

Before the JR schedule revision of March 16, 1996, limited express "Tamba" nos. 1 and 2 (these trains run to Nishi-Maizuru Station as local trains), No. 5 (this train runs as a local train from Nishi-Maizuru Station), nos. 8, and 9 would stop at Iwataki-guchi Station.

Before the JR schedule revision of March 16, 1996, Limited Express 'Tanba (train)' nos. 1 and 2 (these trains run to Nishi-Maizuru Station as local trains), No. 5 (this train runs as a local train from Nishi-Maizuru Station), nos. 8, and 9 would stop at Iwatakiguchi Station.
sen.cmt: KTRのサイトより、Iwatakiguchi としました。" → ' としました。Tamba -> Tanba に変更しました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 西舞鶴駅方から見て線路は西に延び、北側に1面のプラットホームがある地上駅。
sen.e: Nishi-Maizuru Station is an aboveground station whose track extends to the west from the direction of Nishi-Maizuru Station, and has a platform to the north.
Nishi-Maizuru Station is an aboveground station whose track extends westward from the direction of Nishi-Maizuru Station, and has a platform to the north.
It is an aboveground station whose track extends westward from the direction of Nishi-Maizuru Station, and has a platform to the north.

sen.j: 駅員は配置されていない。
sen.e: The staff is not stationed.
The station isn't manned.
The station isn't manned.

sen.j: 駅舎は1992年3月新築の比較的新しいものである。
sen.e: The station building was newly built in March 1992, which is relatively new.
The station building was completed in March 1992, so it's relatively new.
The station building was completed in March 1992, so it's relatively new.

sen.j: 日本国有鉄道での開業当初は駅員配置駅で、行き違い施設が設けられていたが、撤去された。
sen.e: When the station was opened by the Japanese National Railways, the staff was stationed and had a pass-by facility, which was removed later.
When the station was opened by Japanese National Railways, it was manned and had a bypass facility, which was later removed.
When the station was opened by Japan National Railways, it was manned and had a facility where inbound and outbound trains could pass one another, but it was later removed.
sen.cmt: 行き違い施設→a facility where inbound and outbound trains could pass one another としました。

sen.j: 日本国有鉄道・JR時代は駅前の煙草屋兼宿屋である、旅館江戸屋のたばこ売り場で切符を販売していた。
sen.e: In the era of the Japanese National Railways and JR, tickets were sold at a tobacco store in the Japanese inn Edo-ya (a tobacco store/an inn), which was located in front of the station.
In the era of Japanese National Railways and JR, tickets were sold at a tobacco store in the Japanese inn Edo-ya (a tobacco store and inn), which was located in front of the station.
In the era of Japan National Railways and JR, tickets were sold at a tobacco store in the Japanese inn Edo-ya (a tobacco store and inn), which was located in front of the station.
sen.cmt: Japan National Railways としました。

sen.j: バス
sen.e: Bus
Bus
Bus services
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 丹後海陸交通｢岩滝口駅｣（駅横・当駅下車すぐ2006年10月1日から、丹海バスの岩滝口駅乗り入れにより北近畿タンゴ鉄道との接続を改善）
sen.e: Iwatakiguchi-ekimae' of the TANGO KAIRIKU KOTSU Co.,Ltd (Adjacent to the station; since October 1, 2006, Tankai Bus has been entering Iwataki-guchi Station, thereby improving the connection between the bus and the Kitakinki Tango Railway as passengers can take a bus right after leaving the station.)

Iwatakiguchi-ekimae,' of the TANGO KAIRIKU KOTSU Co., Ltd., is adjacent to the station; since October 1, 2006, Tankai Bus has entered Iwataki-guchi Station, thereby improving the connection between the bus and the Kitakinki Tango Railway, because passengers can take a bus right after leaving the station.

Iwatakiguchi-eki' (Iwatakiguchi Station) bus stop of the TANGO KAIRIKU KOTSU Co., Ltd., is adjacent to the station; since October 1, 2006, Tankai Bus has entered Iwatakiguchi Station, thereby improving the connection between the bus and the Kitakinki Tango Railway, because passengers can take a bus right after leaving the station.
sen.cmt: KTRのサイトより、Iwatakiguchi としました。

sen.j: かつての「岩滝口駅前」は｢須津｣に名称変更。
sen.e: The old 'Iwatakiguchi-ekimae' was renamed 'Suzu.'
The old 'Iwatakiguchi-ekimae' was renamed 'Suzu.'
The old 'Iwatakiguchi-ekimae' (in front of Iwatakiguchi Station) bus stop was renamed 'Suzu.'
sen.cmt: 岩滝口駅前 の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 駅前は住宅街である。
sen.e: In front of the station is a residential area.
The area in front of the station is residential.
The area in front of the station is residential.

sen.j: (当駅下車徒歩2分)かつての｢岩滝口駅前｣で2006年10月1日より名称変更。
sen.e: (Two-minute walk from the station.) The old 'Iwatakiguchi-ekimae' was renamed 'Suzu' on October 1, 2006.
The old 'Iwatakiguchi-ekimae' was renamed 'Suzu' on October 1, 2006 and is a two-minute walk from the station.
The old 'Iwatakiguchi-ekimae' was renamed 'Suzu' on October 1, 2006 and is a two-minute walk from the station.

sen.j: 定期バスの他に大阪行きの高速バスが運転されている。
sen.e: In addition to the regular bus service, the expressway bus service is operated for Osaka.
In addition to the regular bus service, the expressway bus service is operated for Osaka.
In addition to the regular bus service, the expressway bus service is operated for Osaka.

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約96人である。
sen.e: The number of passengers per day in 2006 was about 96.
The average daily number of passengers in 2006 was 96.
The average daily number of passengers in fiscal 2006 was 96.

sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.e: The station was opened on July 31, 1925.
The station opened on July 31, 1925.
July 31, 1925: The station opened.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日：国鉄分割民営化により、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1987 the station came to be owned by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) by the division and privatization of the Japan National Railways.
On April 1, 1987, consequent upon the division and privatization of Japan National Railways, the station came under the ownership the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
April 1, 1987: Consequent upon the division and privatization of Japan National Railways, the station came under the ownership the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）4月1日：北近畿タンゴ鉄道への宮津線移管により、同鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1990 the Miyazu Line was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway, thereby the station came to be owned by the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
On April 1, 1990, the Miyazu Line was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway, whereby the station came under the ownership of the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
April 1, 1990: The Miyazu Line was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway, whereby the station came under the ownership of the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 1992年（平成4年）3月：現駅舎に改築
sen.e: The station building was rebuilt to the current one in March 1992.
The station building was revised to its current state in March 1992.
March 1992: The station building was refurbished to its current state.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年）10月1日丹海バスの当駅乗り入れによりのバスとの接続を改善する。
sen.e: On October 1, 2006 the Tankai Bus came to enter the station, thus improving the connection between the Kitakinki Tango Railway and the bus.
On October 1, 2006, the Tankai Bus began entering the station, thereby improving the connection between the Kitakinki Tango Railway and the bus.
October 1, 2006: The Tankai Bus began entering the station, thereby improving the connection between the Kitakinki Tango Railway and the bus.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現にしました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。
